In addition, every project has a coordinator or project leader that is represented in the LoCoTeam Council. <<BR>><<BR>>On a local level, there are local leaders (coordinators) of the Ubuntu-ni local groups organized in the Universities and Departments across the country. The local groups are autonomous entities that are pretty much free to define their own goals, activities and projects according to their specific needs. <<BR>><<BR>>'''Roadmap''' <<BR>><<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Membership''' - Grow, both in quantity and quality. Reach the number of 100 active members by the end of the year. Begin our <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-ni/2007-March/000171.html|Classroom Project]]</nowiki> in order to increase the expertise and knowledge of our members so they can contribute in a better way to the community. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Local Groups''' - Establish one <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam-ListadoGruposLocales|local group]]</nowiki> in each one of the 17 Departments of the country and at least a local representation in every major university. Reaching out and being close to the community is very important for our group. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Working with other organisations''' - Participate in regional community projects and initiatives, such as <nowiki>[[http://www.installfest.info/FLISOL2007/Nicaragua|FLISOL]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu-lat.org/|Ubuntu Latin America]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu-es.org/wiki/doku.php/web:comunidad|Spanish LoCo Teams]]</nowiki>, etc. Engage our members more actively in the Ubuntu community. <<BR>> <nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Advocacy/Installfests/Conferences''' - Continue with the Ubuntu related <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam-LinuxTour2007|conferences]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam-Eventos|workshops]]</nowiki> in the different universities and cities across the country. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Documentation''' - Continue with the translation and/or compilation of <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam-Tutoriales|guides, tutorials]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam-DIYMarketing|Ubuntu marketing material]]</nowiki> in Spanish. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Community Support''' - Improve the community support given in <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-ni|mailing lists]]</nowiki> and the <nowiki>[[http://lug-ilo.homelinux.org/logs/%23ubuntu-ni/|IRC channel]]</nowiki>. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''CD Distribution''' - Finance the local distribution of Ubuntu CDs. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Ubuntu derivative distro/Miskito translation''' - Continue the work with the work on the <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam-UbuntuNica|distro project]]</nowiki> and begin the process of translating Ubuntu to Miskito language. <<BR>><<BR>>'''Experience''' <<BR>><<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Working with LUGs''' - The Ubuntu-ni LocoTeam is a member of the ''Nicaraguan Network for Free and Open Source Software'' (<nowiki>[[http://www.redslcan.org.ni/|REDSLCAN]]</nowiki>). We participate actively in their <nowiki>[[http://list2.enicaragua.org.ni/mailman/listinfo/softwarelibre|mailing lists]]</nowiki>, share information and work together on national issues and events, such as <nowiki>[[http://www.installfest.info/FLISOL2007/Nicaragua|FLISOL 2007 in Nicaragua]]</nowiki>. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''International''' - We at Ubuntu-ni believe in the benefit of cooperation of all the members of the big Ubuntu LoCo family and participates in all joint <nowiki>[[LocosHispanos|initiatives]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu-es.org/wiki/doku.php/web:comunidad:teams|projects]]</nowiki> of the Spanish/<nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu-lat.org/|Latin American]]</nowiki> Teams. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Installfests''' - The Ubuntu-ni Loco Team is the official organizer of <nowiki>[[http://www.installfest.info/FLISOL2007/Nicaragua|FLISOL 2007 in Nicaragua]]</nowiki>. FLISOL is a huge Latin American Installfest/Conference with more than 100 participating cities in 19 countries. The Ubuntu-ni team obtained official support for this event from the <nowiki>[[http://www.unicit.edu.ni/|Ibero-American University of Science and Technology]]</nowiki>. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Advocacy''' - We are currently planning and running a series of Ubuntu related <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam-LinuxTour2007|conferences]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam-Eventos|workshops]]</nowiki>in several Departments of our country. An ambicious <nowiki>[[http://list2.enicaragua.org.ni/pipermail/softwarelibre/2007-March/002284.html|media plan]]</nowiki> is being implemented in occasion of FLISOL and the Feisty Fawn release. The media plan includes several TV appereances, talks in radio shows and newspaper articles and press releases. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Documentation''' - Our team is working hard on compiling <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam-Tutoriales|guides, tutorials, HOWTOs, and other Ubuntu related material]]</nowiki> -including <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam-DIYMarketing|Marketing material]]</nowiki>- in Spanish and make them available to the Spanish speaking community members. A growing group of members are active in <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam?action=fullsearch&context=180&value=nicaragua&titlesearch=T%C3%ADtulos|editing and improving the wiki]]</nowiki>. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Translations''' - A few members are already engaged in the translation of <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam-Tutoriales|Ubuntu related material]]</nowiki> into Spanish. Some of our members are also active members of the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-l10n-es|Ubuntu Spanish Translation Team]]</nowiki>. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Community Support''' - We provide free community support to our members through the <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-ni|mailing list]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://lug-ilo.homelinux.org/logs/%23ubuntu-ni/|IRC channel]]</nowiki>. Our members also provide support and general information about Ubuntu on several local forums: <nowiki>[[http://www.computacion.uni.edu.ni/foros/|Foros Universidad Nacional de Ingenieria]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://bacanalnica.com/foros/viewforum.php?f=10|BN: Computadoras e Internet]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://tecnonica.ief.st/|Tecnonica]]</nowiki>. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Local Groups''' - We are organizing local groups in universities and Departments all around the country in order to make a bigger impact on a local level. Currently we have five <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam-ListadoGruposLocales|local Ubuntu-ni groups]]</nowiki> in Nicaragua. The <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam-UdeM|ubuntu-ni-udem local group]]</nowiki> is officially recognized by the authorities of the <nowiki>[[http://www.udem.edu.ni/|University of Managua]]</nowiki>. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Distribution points''' - The Local Groups (see above) are responsible for the <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam-DistribucionCD|local distribution of Ubuntu CDs]]</nowiki> in Nicaragua in coordination with the national Ubuntu team contact. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Derivative Distribution''' - The Ubuntu-ni <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam-UbuntuNica|distro project's]]</nowiki> aim is to produce a local distribution with language packs available as default from installation and include <nowiki>[[http://bacanalnica.com/foros/viewtopic.php?t=61773|our own national imagery]]</nowiki> to give Ubuntu a local flavour. Work is in progress. <<BR>><nowiki>[[File:flecharoja.png]]</nowiki> '''Miskito Language''' - An important part of the Nicaraguan derivative distribution is the translation of Ubuntu to Miskito language. A Launchpad account has been setup and initial contacts has been taken with the <nowiki>[[http://www.uraccan.edu.ni/|University of the Autonomous Regions of the Nicaraguan Caribbean Coast]]</nowiki> and local NGOs in the municipality of <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prinzapolka|Prinzapolka]]</nowiki>. <<BR>><<BR>> <<BR>> {{http://i72.photobucket.com/albums/i170/miller_h/gohome.png}} <nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam|Home]]</nowiki>
